ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The lecturing style was not particularly engaging. That being said, Tim was always more than happy to stop and discuss any questions students had.
Tim's lecture style is a little dry, but thorough.
The pace for the course was extremely variable. The course started slowly and rapidly became more difficult.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The homework assignments are well-designed to give students hands-on experience with sampling. They are a comprehensive complement to the lecture material that really solidifies the sampling theory discussed.
Getting out in the field at the end of the term and practicing sampling first hand.
Actually going out and practicing data collection and running numbers from data we collected. Katie was also a tremendous teaching fellow that really helped everyone immensely.
Attempting to learn R and understanding the nuances of sampling designs.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: A field trip, if even in the New Haven area, could be nice. There were a few on the lawn of March hall, but more extensive ones could help show the practical side of sampling.
I think we could focus less on theory, don't throw it all out, but some of it. It would be better to do more data collection and analysis of our own data.

R should be taught in a more intensive manner at the beginning of class. It is not an intuitive language. Also, it would be helpful if there was some way to summarize the key points of each sampling technique either at the beginning or end of class.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No discussion lab.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course directly relates to my summer research.
It's important to have a good foundation in sampling as a forester, but would like it tailored more to the professional than the academic.
Understanding how to sample in the field and carry out statistical calculations is extremely important in forestry.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Usefulness and personal interest. Sampling is a useful tool that is applicable across a wide array of disciplines.
More or less required by MF program. I also wanted to know how to design an inventory in my career.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes. The course was fulfilling.
Sort of. I'm not sure what I will retain. I think it will be good enough to know what I don't know and revisit when necessary.
Mostly. Perhaps final projects should have been given out in the beginning so that sampling techniques could be practiced with the same set.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: No group work was conducted.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Make sure you put time in on the homework assignments, as they are well-designed and are helpful for fully understanding the material.
